snippet: The food at Ngam, in the East Village, is not pure Thai, but neither is it watered down.
abstract: Ligaya Mishan reviews Ngam, Thai restaurant in the East Village.

snippet: After a user allows an application on an Apple mobile device to have access to location information, the app can copy the user’s entire photo library, without any further warning.
abstract: After a user allows an application on an Apple mobile device to have access to location information, the app can copy the user’s entire photo library, without any further warning.

headline.main: Apple Loophole Gives Developers Access to Photos

snippet: Apple has sent out press invitations for an iPad event to be held next week in San Francisco. The invitation bears an image of an iPad and says: "We have something you really have to see. And touch."
abstract: Apple has sent out press invitations for an iPad event to be held next week in San Francisco. The invitation bears an image of an iPad and says: "We have something you really have to see. And touch."

headline.main: Apple Confirms March 7 Event for New iPad

snippet: Nokia and Microsoft deliver on the promise of their partnership to produce new smartphones, exceeding their own predictions, and by most estimations, the expectations of many in an industry dominated by Apple and Samsung, whose phones run Google's...
abstract: Nokia and Microsoft deliver on the promise of their partnership to produce new smartphones, exceeding their own predictions, and by most estimations, the expectations of many in an industry dominated by Apple and Samsung, whose phones run Google's Android operating system, reports Kevin J. O'Brien on Tuesday in The New York Times.

headline.main: One Year Later, Nokia and Microsoft Deliver

snippet: The companies have exceeded their own predictions and, by most estimations, the expectations of many in an industry now dominated by Apple, Google and Samsung.
abstract: Nokia and Microsoft, one year after start of their software alliance, have exceeded their own predictions and, by most estimations, the expectations of many; Nokia introduces new cellphones and will open new Windows online marketplaces in 28 countries by March.

headline.main: One Year Later, Nokia and Microsoft Deliver
headline.print_headline: One Year Later, Nokia And Microsoft Deliver

snippet: Nokia and Microsoft hope the new model will help them take market share from Apple's iPhone and others running Google's Android software.

headline.main: Nokia to Offer Lower-Priced Windows Cellphone
headline.print_headline: Nokia to Offer Lower-Priced Windows Cellphone

snippet: 8:19 p.m. | Updated      SAN FRANCISCO - The private photos on your phone may not be as private as you think.
abstract: Photos on Apple mobile devices are vulnerable to a loophole that allows an application to copy the user's entire photo library after being given access to location information; latest privacy concern comes after developers of applications for Apple's mobile devices, along with Apple itself, came under scrutiny when it was reported that some apps were taking people's address book information without their knowledge. Photo (M)

snippet: As Yahoo struggles to keep up with younger competitors, the Web portal company is weighing a new tactic: threatening legal action over its patent holdings.     Yahoo is seeking to force Facebook into licensing 10 to 20 patents over technologies th...
abstract: Yahoo is seeking to force Facebook into licensing 10 to 20 patents over technologies that include advertising, the personalization of Web sites, social networking and messaging. (M)

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED
